page.title: IBM High Rate Wireless LAN Gateway (DR-E200W)

revision.text:

|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = ARM7TDMI-S |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 200 |is_doc = |bus = 32-bit |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Intel;TE28F800C3BA90; |flash1size = 1 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 8 |ram1chip = EtronTech;EM638165TS-7; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Realtek;RTL8019AS; |sw1chip = Marvell;88E6050; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:30:AB |oui = 00:60:B3 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = PCMCIA (16-bit) |exp_pcmcia_num = 1 |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = b |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = default |defaultpass = |defaultssid = ANY |defaultssid_regex = ^ANY$ |default_ch = |manuf = Delta Networks |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 05/08/2001 |estreldate = 2001 |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Z-Com XI-300 |rad1modif = PCMCIA (16-bit) |rad1chip1 = Harris;HFA3841; |rad1chip2 = Intersil;; |rad1chip3 = Intersil;; |rad1chip3modelfull = |rad1oui = 00:60:B3 |rad1_ant_conn = RP-MMCX |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== [http://download.lenovo.com/ibmdl/pub/pc/pccbbs/options/hwlg-rodmst.pdf User's Guide] (dated 2001) P/N: 22P6401, FRU P/N: 22P6409 "DR-E200W" and "2976151101" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
"D144552840416 5508002640 REV: 0" and "6401" is printed on a label affixed to the LAN port casing. The board is highly similar to the [[Compaq iPAQ Connection Point CP-2W]] and the [[Netgear MR314]]. ==Pictures==
